citeinfo.origin: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Carlsbad Fish and Wildlife Office
citeinfo.title: Nevin's barberry - Final Critical Habitat, USFWS [ds424]

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Carlsbad Fish and Wildlife Office

descript.abstract: These data identify, in general, the areas where Final Critical Habitat for Berberis nevinii (Nevin's barberry) occur.
descript.purpose: To provide the user with a general idea of areas where Final Critical Habitat for Berberis nevinii (Nevin's barberry) occur.

idinfo.accconst: This coverage is available from the Carlsbad, California Fish and Wildlife Office of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.
idinfo.useconst: These data are intended to be used as a guide to identify the general areas where Final Critical Habitat for the Berberis nevinii (Nevin's barberry) occur. Specific identity of the Final Critical Habitat should be obtained from the text of the designation of Final Critical Habitat published in: Federal Register (73FR , 8412), February 13, 2008.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Carlsbad Fish and Wildlife Office

idinfo.datacred: U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Carlsbad Fish and Wildlife Office
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Carlsbad Fish and Wildlife Office
citeinfo.title: Final Critical Habitat for Berberis nevinii (Nevin's barberry)

procstep.procdesc: The critical habitat was initially captured based on 1:24,000 digital orthophoto quarter quadrangle images, the California Department of Fish and Game Natural Diversity Database, United States Forest Service information, and USFWS staff biologist knowledge of the habitat and hydrology in the area. Locations that exhibited viable habitat PCE's were designated as areas of critical habitat. Limitations to the actual habitat areas consisted of features like water bodies, non-vegetated extreme or eroded hillsides (slope), and man made features to name a few. Polygon areas that are not subject to the MSHCP plan were retained as "Final Critical Habitat". These areas are considered public quasi-public lands. All critical habitat polygons were mapped to represent only the areas considered essential habitat and legally described using UTM NAD1983 easting and northing coordinates.
Edited original metadata by adding ISO keywords. Reprojected data into California Teale Albers NAD83.

cntperp.cntorg: California Department of Fish and Game

attr.attrdef: Name of critical habitat unit or subunit.
"Final Critical Habitat" means that the polygon is included in the Final Critical Habitat for the species.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Species code for the species in the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service's Environmental Conservation Online System (ECOS).
Organization code of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service office in Carlsbad, CA, which is the contact office for this critical habitat project.
Unit number of critical habitat unit.
Subunit letter of critical habitat subunit, if any.

This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. stdorder.ordering: Email or fax request. Be sure to include your name, address, email address, and the name of the species for which you are requesting the critical habitat coverage. The Arc/INFO export file will be emailed to you or sent on CD.

distinfo.techpreq: Importing this export file (.e00) into ArcGIS 9 may require additional steps. Go to: http://support.esri.com/index.cfm?fa=knowledgebase.techarticles.articleShow&d=21052 to review the procedure. If you only have ArcView 3.x, you can use the Import7.1 Utility in the BIN32 folder.
